field.name: BUSY
field.description: Set when ITM events present and being drained

interpretation.text: ITM Idle
ITM Busy

field.name: TraceBusID
field.description: Optional identifier for multi-source trace stream formatting

field.name: TSPrescale
field.description: Timestamp prescaler

interpretation.text: No prescaling
Divide by 4
divide by 16
divide by 64

field.name: SWOENA
field.description: Enables asynchronous-specific usage model for timestamps

interpretation.text: Mode disabled. Uses system clock from the core
Uses lineout (data related) clock from TPIU interface

field.name: TXENA
field.description: Enable hardware event packet emission from the DWT

field.name: SYNCENA
field.description: Enable synchronization packet transmission for a synchronous TPIU

field.name: TSENA
field.description: Enable differential timestamps

field.name: ITMENA
field.description: Enable ITM

field.name: NUMCOMP
field.description: Number of comparators implemented

field.name: NOTRCPKT
field.description: Shows whether the implementation supports trace sampling and exception tracing

interpretation.text: Trace sampling and exception tracing supported
Trace sampling and exception tracing not supported

field.name: NOEXTTRIG
field.description: Shows whether the implementation includes external match signals

interpretation.text: CMPMATCH[N] supported
CMPMATCH[N] not supported

field.name: NOCYCCNT
field.description: Shows whether the implementation supports a cycle counter

interpretation.text: Cycle counter supported
Cycle counter not supported

field.name: NOPRFCNT
field.description: Shows whether the implementation supports the profiling counters

interpretation.text: Not supported

field.name: CYCEVTENA
field.description: Enables POSTCNT underflow Event counter packets generation

interpretation.text: No POSTCNT underflow packets generated
POSTCNT underflow packets generated, if PCSAMPLENA set to 0

field.name: FOLDEVTENA
field.description: Enables generation of the Folded-instruction counter overflow event

field.name: LSUEVTENA
field.description: Enables generation of the LSU counter overflow event

field.name: SLEEPEVTENA
field.description: Enables generation of the Sleep counter overflow event

field.name: EXCEVTENA
field.description: Enables generation of the Exception overhead counter overflow event

field.name: CPIEVTENA
field.description: Enables generation of the CPI counter overflow event

field.name: EXCTRCENA
field.description: Enables generation of exception trace

field.name: PCSAMPLENA
field.description: Enables use of POSTCNT counter as a timer for Periodic PC sample packet generation

interpretation.text: No Periodic PC sample packets generated
Periodic PC sample packets generated

field.name: SYNCTAP
field.description: Selects the position of the synchronization packet counter tap on the CYCCNT counter

interpretation.text: Disabled. No Synchronization packets
Synchronization counter tap at CYCCNT[24]
Synchronization counter tap at CYCCNT[26]
Synchronization counter tap at CYCCNT[28]

field.name: CYCTAP
field.description: Selects the position of the POSTCNT tap on the CYCCNT counter

interpretation.text: POSTCNT tap at CYCCNT[6]
POSTCNT tap at CYCCNT[10]

field.name: POSTINIT
field.description: Initial value for the POSTCNT counter

field.name: POSTPRESET
field.description: Reload value for the POSTCNT counter

field.name: CYCCNTENA
field.description: Enables CYCCNT

field.name: EIASAMPLE
field.description: Executed Instruction Address sample value

interpretation.text: Processor is in Debug state

field.name: COMP
field.description: Reference value for comparison

field.name: MASK
field.description: The size of the ignore mask, 0-31 bits, applied to address range matching

field.name: MATCHED
field.description: A value of 1 indicates that the operation defined by the FUNCTION field occurred since the last read of the register

interpretation.text: No match

field.name: DATAVADDR1
field.description: When the DATAVMATCH and LNK1ENA bits are both 1, this field can hold the comparator number of a second comparator to use for linked address comparison

field.name: DATAVADDR0
field.description: When the DATAVMATCH bit is set to 1 this field can hold the comparator number of a comparator to use for linked address comparison

field.name: DATAVSIZE
field.description: For data value matching, specifies the size of the required data comparison

field.name: LNK1ENA
field.description: Indicates whether the implementation supports use of a second linked comparator

interpretation.text: Second linked comparator not supported
Second linked comparator supported

field.name: DATAVMATCH
field.description: Enables data value comparison, if supported

interpretation.text: Perform address comparison
Perform data value comparison

field.name: CYCMATCH
field.description: If the implementation supports cycle counting, enable cycle count comparison for comparator 0

interpretation.text: No comparison is performed
Compare DWT_COMP0 with the cycle counter, DWT_CYCCNT

field.name: EMITRANGE
field.description: If the implementation supports trace sampling, enables generation of Data trace address offset packets, that hold Daddr[15:0]

interpretation.text: Data trace address offset packets disabled
Enable Data trace address offset packet generation

field.name: FUNCTION
field.description: Selects action taken on comparator match

field.name: finterp
field.description: Interpretation of DATAVMATCH+CYCMATCH+EMITRANGE+FUNCTION fields

interpretation.text: Comparator disabled, or part of a LinkAddr comparison
Daddr: Generate Data trace PC value packet
Daddr: Generate Data trace data value packet
Daddr: Generate Data trace PC value and data value packets
Iaddr: Generate PC watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate RO watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate WO watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate RW watchpoint debug event
Iaddr: Generate CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RO CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate WO CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RW CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RO Data trace data value packet
Daddr: Generate WO Data trace data value packet
Daddr: Generate RO Data trace PC value and data value packets
Daddr: Generate WO Data trace PC value and data value packets
Comparator disabled, or part of a LinkAddr comparison
Daddr: Generate Data trace address offset packet
Daddr: Generate Data trace address offset and data value packets
Daddr: Generate Data trace address offset and data value packets
Iaddr: Generate PC watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate RO watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate WO watchpoint debug event
Daddr: Generate RW watchpoint debug event
Iaddr: Generate CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RO CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate WO CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RW CMPMATCH[N] event
Daddr: Generate RO Data trace address offset packet
Daddr: Generate WO Data trace address offset packet
Daddr: Generate RO Generate Data trace address offset and data value packets
Daddr: Generate WO Generate Data trace address offset and data value packets
CYCmatch: Comparator disabled
CYCmatch: Generate Data trace PC value packet
CYCmatch: Generate watchpoint debug event
CYCmatch: Generate CMPMATCH[N] event
Dval: Disabled
Dval: Generate RO watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate WO watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate RW watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate RO CMPMATCH[N] event
Dval: Generate WO CMPMATCH[N] event
Dval: Generate RW CMPMATCH[N] event

Daddr: Generate WO Generate Data trace address offset and data value packets
Dval: Disabled
Dval: Generate RO watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate WO watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate RW watchpoint debug event
Dval: Generate RO CMPMATCH[N] event
Dval: Generate WO CMPMATCH[N] event
Dval: Generate RW CMPMATCH[N] event

field.name: COMP
field.description: Reference value for comparison

field.name: MASK
field.description: The size of the ignore mask, 0-31 bits, applied to address range matching

field.name: MATCHED
field.description: A value of 1 indicates that the operation defined by the FUNCTION field occurred since the last read of the register

interpretation.text: No match

field.name: DATAVADDR1
field.description: When the DATAVMATCH and LNK1ENA bits are both 1, this field can hold the comparator number of a second comparator to use for linked address comparison

field.name: DATAVADDR0
field.description: When the DATAVMATCH bit is set to 1 this field can hold the comparator number of a comparator to use for linked address comparison

field.name: DATAVSIZE
field.description: For data value matching, specifies the size of the required data comparison

field.name: LNK1ENA
field.description: Indicates whether the implementation supports use of a second linked comparator

interpretation.text: Second linked comparator not supported
Second linked comparator supported

field.name: DATAVMATCH
field.description: Enables data value comparison, if supported

interpretation.text: Perform address comparison
Perform data value comparison

field.name: EMITRANGE
field.description: If the implementation supports trace sampling, enables generation of Data trace address offset packets, that hold Daddr[15:0]

interpretation.text: Data trace address offset packets disabled
Enable Data trace address offset packet generation

field.name: FUNCTION
field.description: Selects action taken on comparator match

field.name: finterp
field.description: Interpretation of DATAVMATCH+EMITRANGE+FUNCTION fields

interpretation.text: Comparator disabled, or part of a LinkAddr comparison

field.name: NUM_CODE[6:4]
field.description: The most significant bits of NUM_CODE

field.name: NUM_LIT
field.description: The number of literal address comparators supported

field.name: NUM_CODE[3:0]
field.description: The least significant bits of NUM_CODE

field.name: KEY
field.description: RAZ. On any write to CTRL, the FPB unit ignores the write unless this bit is 1

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable bit for the FPB

field.name: RMPSPT
field.description: Indicates whether the FPB unit supports flash patch remap

interpretation.text: Remapping not supported. The FPB only supports breakpoint functionality
Hard-wired remap to SRAM region

field.name: REMAP
field.description: Holds bits [28:5] of the base address in SRAM to which the FPB remaps the address

field.name: REPLACE
field.description: Defines the behavior when the COMP address is matched

interpretation.text: Remap to remap address
Breakpoint on lower halfword, upper is unaffected
Breakpoint on upper halfword, lower is unaffected
Breakpoint on both lower and upper halfwords

field.name: COMP
field.description: Bits [28:2] of the address to compare with addresses from the Code memory region

field.description: Enable bit for this comparator

field.description: Defines the behavior when the COMP address is matched

field.name: COMP
field.description: Bits [28:2] of the address to compare with addresses from the Code memory region

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enable bit for this comparator

field.name: DISFOLD
field.description: Disables folding of IT instructions

interpretation.text: Folding IT disabled
Folding IT enabled

field.name: DISDEFWBUF
field.description: Disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

interpretation.text: Buffering disabled
Buffering enabled

field.name: DISMCYCINT
field.description: Disables interruption of multi-cycle instructions

interpretation.text: Interruption disabled
Interruption enabled

field.name: VARIANT
field.description: Indicates processor revision (r)

field.name: ARCHITECTURE
field.description: Reads as 0xF if CPUID scheme is in use

interpretation.text: Use of the CPUID scheme

field.name: PARTNO
field.description: Number of processor within family

interpretation.text: ARMv7M version 0

field.name: REVISION
field.description: Patch release (p)

field.name: NMIPENDSET
field.description: Setting this bit will activate an NMI

interpretation.text: NMI inctive
NMI active

field.name: PENDSVSET
field.description: Set a pending PendSV interrupt

interpretation.text: PendSV not pending
PendSV pending

field.name: PENDSVCLR
field.description: Clear a pending PendSV interrupt

interpretation.text: PendSV clear?
PendSV set?

field.name: PENDSTSET
field.description: Set a pending SysTick

interpretation.text: SysTick not pending
SysTick pending

field.name: PENDSTCLR
field.description: Clear a pending SysTick

interpretation.text: SysTick clear?
SysTick set?

field.name: VECTPENDING
field.description: Indicates the exception number for the highest priority pending exception

interpretation.text: No pending exceptions
1 exception number?
2 exception number etc ?

field.name: RETTOBASE
field.description: In Handler mode indicates no active exceptions other than the exception shown by the IPSR

interpretation.text: More active exceptions
No active exception other than this in IPSR

field.name: VECTACTIVE
field.description: Indicates the exception number for the highest priority pending exception. Same as IPSR[8:0]

interpretation.text: Thread Mode
1 exception number?
2 exception number etc ?

field.name: TBLBASE
field.description: Location of a vector table base

interpretation.text: Table base is in CODE, at 0x00000000
Table base is in RAM, at 0x20000000

field.name: TBLOFF
field.description: Table offset address from the base address, 32-word aligned

register.name: AIRCR
register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

field.name: VECTKEY
field.description: Vector Key. 0x05FA must be written anytime this register is written. Reads as 0xFA05

field.name: ENDIANNESS
field.description: Endianness of data bus

interpretation.text: Little endian
Big endian

field.name: PRIGROUP
field.description: Priority grouping position (binary point)

interpretation.text: No priority grouping
1.7 mode ??

field.name: SYSRESETREQ
field.description: Causes a signal to be asserted to the external system

interpretation.text: Not active
Request system reset

field.name: VECTCLRACTIVE
field.description: Clears all active state information for fixed and configurable exceptions

interpretation.text: Not active
Clear active state information

field.name: VECTRESET
field.description: Local system reset

interpretation.text: Not active
Generate local reset

field.name: SEVONPEND
field.description: Interrupt transitions from Inactive to Pending as wakeup event for the WFE instruction

interpretation.text: Not active
Treat transitions as wakeup event

field.name: SLEEPDEEP
field.description: A qualifying hint that indicates waking from sleep might take longer

interpretation.text: Not active
Waking may take longer

field.name: SLEEPONEXIT
field.description: The core can enter a sleep state on return to Thread mode with no active exception handlers

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: STKALIGN
field.description: Adjusts stack alignment

interpretation.text: 4-byte alignment
8-byte alignment

field.name: BFHFNMIGN
field.description: Handlers running at priority -1 and -2 ignore precise data access faults

interpretation.text: Bus Faults cause lock-ups
Ignore precise data access faults

field.name: DIV_0_TRP
field.description: Trap on divide by 0

field.name: UNALIGN_TRP
field.description: Enables trap on unaligned half or full word access

field.name: USERSETMPEND
field.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the Software Trigger Interrupt Register

interpretation.text: The core allows unprivileged (user) code to write the STIR

field.name: NONBASETHRDENA
field.description: Configures how the processor enters Thread mode

interpretation.text: Thread state can only be entered at the Base level of activation (will fault if attempted to another level of activation)
Thread state can be entered at any level by controlled return value

field.name: PRI_6
field.description: UsageFault exception priority

field.name: PRI_5
field.description: BusFault exception priority

field.name: PRI_4
field.description: MemManage exception priority

field.name: PRI_11
field.description: SVCall exception priority

field.name: PRI_15
field.description: SysTick exception priority

field.name: PRI_14
field.description: PendSV exception priority

field.name: PRI_12
field.description: DebugMon exception priority

register.name: SHCSR
register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

field.name: USGFAULTENA
field.description: Usage fault enable bit

field.name: BUSFAULTENA
field.description: Bus fault enable bit

field.name: MEMFAULTENA
field.description: Memory management fault enable bit

field.name: SVCALLPENDED
field.description: SVC call pending bit

interpretation.text: Not pending

field.name: BUSFAULTPENDED
field.description: Bus fault exception pending bit

interpretation.text: Not pending

field.name: MEMFAULTPENDED
field.description: Memory management fault exception pending bit

interpretation.text: Not pending

field.name: USGFAULTPENDED
field.description: Usage fault exception pending bit

interpretation.text: Not pending

field.name: SYSTICKACT
field.description: SysTick exception active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: PENDSVACT
field.description: PendSV exception active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: MONITORACT
field.description: Debug monitor active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: SVCALLACT
field.description: SVC call active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: USGFAULTACT
field.description: Usage fault exception active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: BUSFAULTACT
field.description: Bus fault exception active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

field.name: MEMFAULTACTA
field.description: Memory management fault exception active bit

interpretation.text: Not active

register.name: CFSR
register.description: rc_w1. Configurable Fault Status Register UFSR:BFSR:MMFSR

field.name: DIVBYZERO
field.description: Divide by zero usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Divide by zero error

field.name: UNALIGNED
field.description: Unaligned access usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Unaligned access error

field.name: NOCP
field.description: No coprocessor usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Coprocessor access error (the coprocessor is disabled or not present)

field.name: INVPC
field.description: Invalid PC load usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Integrity check error on EXC_RETURN

field.name: INVSTATE
field.description: Invalid state usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Invalid EPSR.T bit or illegal EPSR.IT bits for executing instruction

field.name: UNDEFINSTR
field.description: Undefined instruction usage fault

interpretation.text: Not active
UNDEFINED instruction executed

field.name: BFARVALID
field.description: Bus Fault Address Register (BFAR) valid flag

interpretation.text: BFAR register has invalid contents
BFAR register has valid contents

field.name: STKERR
field.description: Bus fault on stacking for exception entry

interpretation.text: Not active
A derived bus fault has occurred on exception entry

field.name: UNSTKERR
field.description: Bus fault on unstacking for a return from exception

interpretation.text: Not active
A derived bus fault has occurred on exception return

field.name: IMPRECISERR
field.description: Imprecise data bus error

interpretation.text: Not active
Imprecise data access error

field.name: PRECISERR
field.description: Precise data bus error

interpretation.text: Not active
Precise data access error. The BFAR is written with the faulting address

field.name: IBUSERR
field.description: Instruction bus error. The fault is only signalled if the instruction is issued

interpretation.text: Not active
This bit indicates a bus fault on an instruction prefetch

field.name: MMARVALID
field.description: Memory Management Fault Address Register (MMAR) valid flag

interpretation.text: MMAR register has invalid contents
MMAR register has valid contents

field.name: MSTKERR
field.description: Memory manager fault on stacking for exception entry

interpretation.text: Not active
A derived MemManage fault has occurred on exception entry

field.name: MUNSTKERR
field.description: Memory manager fault on unstacking for a return from exception

interpretation.text: Not active
A derived MemManage fault has occurred on exception return

field.name: DACCVIOL
field.description: Data access violation flag

interpretation.text: Not active
Data access violation. The MMAR is set to the data address which the load/store tried to access

field.name: IACCVIOL
field.description: Instruction access violation flag. The fault is only signalled if the instruction is issued

interpretation.text: Not active
MPU or eXecuteNever (XN) default memory map access violation on an instruction fetch

field.name: DEBUGEVT
field.description: Update of DFSR during debug event

interpretation.text: Not active
Debug Fault Status Register has been updated

field.name: FORCED
field.description: Forced hard fault. Priority escalated to a HardFault exception

interpretation.text: Not active
Configurable fault cannot be activated due to priority or because it is disabled

field.name: VECTTBL
field.description: Vector table hard fault

interpretation.text: Not active
Configurable fault cannot be activated due to priority or because it is disabled

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: Data address MPU faulted

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: Faulting address associated with the attempted access

field.name: AUXFAULT
field.description: Contains additional system fault information

field.name: CP0
field.description: Coprocessor 0 access. If a bit pair is written with a 0b01 or 0b11 and it reads back as 0b00, the coprocessor is not fitted

interpretation.text: Access denied
Privileged access only
Full access

field.name: INTID
field.description: The interrupt to be triggered. This is the same as NVIC->ISPRx

register.name: DHCSR
register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

field.name: DBGKEY
field.description: Debug Key. 0xA05F must be written whenever this register is written

field.name: S_RESET_ST
field.description: Sticky rc_r. Indicates that the core has been reset, or is now being reset, since the last time this bit was read

interpretation.text: Reset in the past
Device held in reset

field.name: S_RETIRE_ST
field.description: Sticky rc_r. Indicates that an instruction has completed since last read

interpretation.text: Not stalled on a load/store or fetch
Stalled on a load/store or fetch

field.name: S_LOCKUP
field.description: Reads as one if the core is running (not halted) and a lockup condition is present

interpretation.text: No lockup if running
Lockup if running

field.name: S_SLEEP
field.description: Indicates that the core is sleeping

interpretation.text: Not sleeping

field.name: S_HALT
field.description: Indicates that the core is in debug state

interpretation.text: Not in debug state
In debug state

field.name: S_REGRDY
field.description: Register Read/Write on the Debug Core Register Selector register is available. Last transfer is complete

interpretation.text: Last transfer pending
Last transfer complete

field.name: C_SNAPSTALL
field.description: If the core is stalled on Load or Store operation, a debugger can set this bit to break the stall

interpretation.text: No action
Force to complete

field.name: C_MASKINTS
field.description: Mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts when debug is enabled

interpretation.text: No action
Mask IRQs

field.name: C_STEP
field.description: Step the core

interpretation.text: No action
Make one step

field.name: C_HALT
field.description: Halt the core

interpretation.text: No action
Halt the core

field.name: C_DEBUGEN
field.description: Enable halting debug

field.name: REGWnR
field.description: Access type of the selected register

field.name: REGSEL
field.description: Selected register

interpretation.text: xPSR/Flags, Execution Number, state information
CONTROL[31:24], FAULTMASK[23:16], BASEPRI[15:8] and PRIMASK[7:0]

field.name: DBGTMP
field.description: Data temporary cache, for reading and writing registers

register.name: DEMCR
register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

field.name: TRCENA
field.description: Global enable for all features configured and controlled by the DWT and ITM blocks

field.name: MON_REQ
field.description: A DebugMonitor semaphore bit

field.name: MON_STEP
field.description: A DebugMonitor equivalent of C_STEP in Debug state

interpretation.text: No action
Make one step

field.name: MON_PEND
field.description: Pend the DebugMonitor exception to activate when priority allows

interpretation.text: No action
Pend DebugMonior

field.name: MON_EN
field.description: Enable the DebugMonitor exception

field.name: VC_HARDERR
field.description: Debug trap on a HardFault exception

field.name: VC_INTERR
field.description: Debug trap on a fault occurring during an exception entry or return sequence

field.name: VC_BUSERR
field.description: Debug trap on a BusFault exception

field.name: VC_STATERR
field.description: Debug trap on a UsageFault exception due to a state information error

field.name: VC_CHKERR
field.description: Debug trap on a UsageFault exception due to a checking error

field.name: VC_NOCPERR
field.description: Debug trap on a UsageFault access to a Coprocessor

field.name: VC_MMERR
field.description: Debug trap on a MemManage exception

field.name: VC_CORERESET
field.description: Reset Vector Catch

field.name: EXTERNAL
field.description: rc_w1. An asynchronous exception generated due to the assertion of EDBGRQ

interpretation.text: No signal
EDBGRQ asserted

field.name: VCATCH
field.description: rc_w1. Vector catch triggered. Corresponding FSR will contain the primary cause of the exception

interpretation.text: No signal
Vecor catch

field.name: DWTTRAP
field.description: rc_w1. Data Watchpoint and Trace trap

interpretation.text: No signal
DWT trap

field.name: BKPT
field.description: rc_w1. BKPT instruction executed or breakpoint match in FPB

interpretation.text: No signal
BKPT hit

field.name: HALTED
field.description: rc_w1. C_HALT, C_STEP or MON_STEP event

interpretation.text: No signal
Single step taken

field.name: ISRPREEMPT
field.description: If set, a pending exception will be serviced on exit from the debug halt state

interpretation.text: No pending exception
Pending exception will be serviced

field.name: ISRPENDING
field.description: Indicates if an external configurable (NVIC generated) interrupt is pending

interpretation.text: Not pending

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Indicates the enabled status of the SysTick counter

interpretation.text: Counter is disabled
Counter is enabled

field.name: TICKINT
field.description: Indicates whether counting to 0 causes the status of the SysTick exception to change to pending

interpretation.text: Count to 0 does not affect the SysTick exception status
Count to 0 changes the SysTick exception status to pending

field.name: CLKSOURCE
field.description: Indicates the SysTick clock source

interpretation.text: SysTick uses the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED external reference clock
SysTick uses the processor clock

field.name: COUNTFLAG
field.description: Indicates whether the counter has counted to 0 since the last read of this register

interpretation.text: Timer has not counted to 0
Timer has counted to 0

field.name: LOAD
field.description: Reload value of a counter

field.name: VAL
field.description: Current value of a counter

field.name: IREGION
field.description: Instruction region

interpretation.text: Unified MPU

field.name: DREGION
field.description: Number of regions supported by MPU

interpretation.text: MPU not supported

field.name: SEPARATE
field.description: Separate or unified instruction or data regions

interpretation.text: Support for unified instruction and data address maps
Support for separate instruction and data address maps

field.name: PRIVDEFENA
field.description: Default memory map for privileged access

interpretation.text: Disables the default memory map. Any instruction or data access that does not access a defined region faults
Enables the default memory map as a background region for privileged access

field.name: HFNMIENA
field.description: Controls whether handlers executing with priority less than 0 access memory with the MPU enabled or with the MPU disabled

interpretation.text: Disables the MPU for these handlers
Use the MPU for memory accesses by these handlers

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enables MPU

interpretation.text: MPU is disabled
MPU is enabled

field.name: REGION
field.description: Selects the region currently accessed by RBAR and RSAR

field.name: ADDR
field.description: Base address of the region

field.name: VALID
field.description: Controls whether handlers executing with priority less than 0 access memory with the MPU enabled or with the MPU disabled

interpretation.text: Update the base address of the region indicated by RNR, ignoring the value of the REGION field
Update RNR.REGION to the value obtained by zero extending the REGION value specified in this write, and apply the base address update to this region

field.name: REGION
field.description: The number of the region to update

field.name: XN
field.description: Region Attribute field. Execute Never

interpretation.text: Execution of an instruction fetched from this region permitted
Execution of an instruction fetched from this region not permitted

field.name: AP
field.description: Region Attribute field. Access Permision AP[2:0]

interpretation.text: Privileged: No access, Unprivileged: No access
Privileged: Read/Write, Unprivileged: No access
Privileged: Read/Write, Unprivileged: Read-only
Privileged: Read/Write, Unprivileged: Read/Write
Privileged: Unpredictable, Unprivileged: Unpredictable
Privileged: Read-only, Unprivileged: No access
Privileged: Read-only, Unprivileged: Read-only
Privileged: Read-only, Unprivileged: Read-only

field.name: TEXSCB
field.description: Region Attribute field. TEX[2:0],S,C,B

interpretation.text: Strongly ordered, shareable
Shared device, shareable
Outer and inner write-through, no write allocate, non-shareable
Outer and inner write-back, no write allocate, non-shareable
Strongly ordered, shareable
Shared device, shareable
Outer and inner write-through, no write allocate, shareable
Outer and inner write-back, no write allocate, shareable
Implementatin defined
Outer and inner write-back, write and read allocate, non-shareable
Implementatin defined
Outer and inner write-back, write and read allocate, sharable
Non-shared device, non-sharable
Non-shared device, non-sharable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: non-cacheable, non-shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-back, write and read allocate, non-shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-through, no write allocate, non-shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-back, no write allocate, non-shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: non-cacheable, shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-back, write and read allocate, shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-through, no write allocate, shareable
Outer: non-cacheable, inner: write-back, no write allocate, shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: non-cacheable, non-shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: write-back, write and read allocate, non-shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: write-through, no write allocate, non-shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: write-back, no write allocate, non-shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: non-cacheable, shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: write-back, write and read allocate, shareable
Outer: write-back, write and read allocate, inner: write-through, no write allocate, shareable

field.name: SRD
field.description: Subregion Disable=1, Subregion Enable=0

field.name: SIZE
field.description: Indicates the region size

interpretation.text: 32B - UNPREDICTABLE if SRD set
64B - UNPREDICTABLE if SRD set
128B - UNPREDICTABLE if SRD set

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: Enables this region

interpretation.text: When the MPU is enabled, this region is disabled
When the MPU is enabled, this region is enabled

register.name: RBAR_A1
register.description: Alias 1 of Region Base Address Register

register.name: RASR_A1
register.description: Alias 1 of Region Attribute and Size Register

register.name: RBAR_A2
register.description: Alias 2 of Region Base Address Register

register.name: RASR_A2
register.description: Alias 2 of Region Attribute and Size Register

register.name: RBAR_A3
register.description: Alias 3 of Region Base Address Register

register.name: RASR_A3
register.description: Alias 3 of Region Attribute and Size Register

field.name: SIZE
field.description: Each bit location represents a supported port size

interpretation.text: None supported
Width of 1 bit supported
Width of 2 bit supported
Width of 1 and 2 bits supported
Width of 4 bits supported
Width of 1 and 4 bits supported
Width of 2 and 4 bits supported
Width of 1,2 and 4 bits supported

field.name: CWIDTH
field.description: Defines the width of the current parallel trace port, if supported

interpretation.text: Width of 1 bit
Width of 2 bits
Width of 4 bits

field.name: SWOSCALER
field.description: SWO output clock = Asynchronous_Reference_Clock/(SWOSCALAR +1)

field.name: PROTOCOL
field.description: Selects which protocol to use for trace output

interpretation.text: Synchronous Trace Port Mode/Parallel
Asynchronous Serial Wire Output (Manchester)
Asynchronous Serial Wire Output (NRZ)

field.name: NRZVALID
field.description: Serial Wire Output (UART/NRZ) support

interpretation.text: Not supported

field.name: MANCVALID
field.description: Serial Wire Output (Manchester encoding) support

interpretation.text: Not supported

field.name: PTINVALID
field.description: Trace data and clock support/Indicates support for parallel trace port operation

interpretation.text: Not supported?

field.name: FIFOSZ
field.description: Minimum output FIFO depth for trace information

interpretation.text: 1 byte
2 bytes
4 bytes
8 bytes
16 bytes
32 bytes
64 bytes
128 bytes
